intro: Praxelis sanctopaulensis, commonly known as the São Paulo nightshade, is a flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like tomatoes and potatoes. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale blue in color. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and have a slightly hairy texture. Praxelis sanctopaulensis is often found in moist, shaded areas within tropical forests.
